item.title: Steam In-Home Streaming Demoed on a Toshiba Chromebook 2
item.description: This video demonstrates game play on a Toshiba Chromebook 2 running Xubuntu via Crouton using the Steam In-Home Streaming technology.

item.title: Play Doom and Quake on a Chromebook when Offline
item.description: This short video demos playing the shareware version of Doom on a Samsung Chromebook. It is a flash based game, which can be played while the Chromebook is offline.

item.title: Playing Doom and Quake on the Ben NanoNote
item.description: These two videos show the SDL port of Quake and a free version of Doom being played on the Ben NanoNote pocket computer. They were created by TUXBRAIN

item.title: TINT: Playing Tetris in the Linux Terminal
item.description: TINT is a clone of the venerable Tetris game, that you play inside your Linux terminal as shown in this video by Luis.

item.title: Urban Terror on Starling Netbook with UNR 9.10
item.description: This video is a short demonstration of the free multiplayer first person shooter Urban Terror being played on System76's Starling netbook. The netbook which

item.title: Playing Final Fantasy on the ASUS Eee PC
item.description: This video by khanh demonstrates Final Fantasy VII being played on a basic ASUS Eee PC 701 running Xandros Linux without CPU overclocking or hardware upgrades.

item.title: Sid Meier's Pirates on Acer Aspire One
item.description: I can't say how much time I spent playing Pirates on the Amiga but it sufficed to know any Caribbean city that appears in the game.

item.title: Firefox and Quake III Arena on Acer Aspire One
item.description: Maybe Freddie Mercury would turn over in his grave hearing Queen's Mr. Fahrenheit Don't Stop me Now as the background music for a video demonstrating Firefox
